summary: This bill, the Runaway and Homeless Youth and Trafficking Prevention Act of 2025, reauthorizes the Runaway and Homeless Youth Act. It amends various sections related to grants for centers providing shelter and services to runaway, homeless, and street youth, including those at risk of trafficking.  The bill increases funding for programs, emphasizes trauma-informed care and culturally sensitive services, and adds provisions for online outreach, data collection, and independent student status. It also establishes a new prevention services grant and addresses nondiscrimination.
